definition: to take loving care of/to value
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

sentences.english: Demand for maintenance and spare you go.
But we were gentle in your midst, as a nursing mother would cherish her own children.
sentences.chinese: 只在你们中间为人温和，如同乳母顾惜自己的孩子。

sentences.english: you shall cut off her hand. Show her no pity.
sentences.chinese: 就要砍断妇人的手，眼不可顾惜她。

sentences.english: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies or the wicked are cruel.
sentences.chinese: 义人顾惜牲畜的生命主，恶人都是残暴不仁。

sentences.english: The righteous know the needs of their animals, but the mercy of the wicked is cruel.
sentences.chinese: 义人顾惜他牲畜的命，恶人的怜悯也是残忍。

sentences.english: Then thou shalt cut off her hand, thine eye shall not pity her.
sentences.chinese: 就要砍断妇人的手，眼不可顾惜她。

definition: to cater to sb to make them happy (esp. of one's parents)
a branch of the Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/two-character surname Murong
crown prince/heir of a noble house
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to stick up for a wrongdoer
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
